广告牌 https://www.billboard.com音乐排行榜、新闻、照片和视频2023 年 11 月 16 日星期四 16:21:14 +0000 en-US每小时1 https://wordpress.org/?v=6.2.3 Robert Kyncl 阐述了 WMG 的三管齐下的人工智能方法https://www.billboard.com/pro/warner-music-artificial-intelligence-robert-kyncl-comments/Elias Leight Thu, 16 Nov 2023 15:48:16 +0000 BusinessTechartificial intelligencewarner https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235473568 The CEO spoke about the importance of monitoring platforms and government regulation in a call with financial analysts

华纳音乐集团首席执行官Robert Kyncl在周四（11 月 16 日）与金融分析师的电话会议上赞扬了 YouTube 的人工智能语音生成实验，该实验于本周启动，包括 Charlie Puth 和 Charli XCX 在内的多位华纳艺人参与其中。

Kyncl 提出了一个思想实验：“想象一下，在 2000 年代初，如果文件共享公司来到音乐行业，并说，‘您愿意尝试一下我们构建的这个新工具，看看它对行业有何影响以及如何发挥作用吗？我们可以一起工作吗？这将是令人难以置信的。”

有关的

YouTube 创作者现在可以使用人工智能来模仿流行明星

11/16/2023

虽然很难想象 2000 年代初厌恶技术的音乐行业会抓住这个机会，但 Kyncl 将 YouTube 的努力描述为“第一次，一个拥有新工具的大规模大型平台主动主动地联系其[音乐]合作伙伴进行测试和学习。” “我只是想强调这种参与的重要性，”他补充道。 （他曾担任 YouTube 首席商务官。）

为了分析师的利益，Kyncl 还概述了该公司管理人工智能技术快速崛起的三管齐下的方法。首先，他表示，重要的是要关注“生成式人工智能引擎”，确保它们“许可训练内容”模型，“保存输入记录以便追踪出处”，并使用“水印”系统，以便可以跟踪输出。

有关的

下半年反弹后，华纳音乐全年突破 60 亿美元里程碑

11/16/2023

华纳的下一个重点领域是：Spotify、TikTok、YouTube、Instagram 等平台，正如 Kyncl 所说，“大部分内容……最终都会出现，因为创作者想要观看或直播。”为了管理人工智能生成的音乐在这些服务上的激增，Kyncl 希望以音乐行业围绕用户生成的内容（尤其是 YouTube）的监控和货币化所开发的蓝图为基础，并“为人工智能时代写下精美的文字”。

最后但并非最不重要的一点是，Kyncl 表示，他正在与政治家和监管机构会面，“以确保围绕人工智能的监管尊重创意产业。”他提出了这个领域的两个关键目标：“需要获得训练[人工智能模型]的许可”，以及“名称、图像、肖像和声音受到与版权相同的保护”。

; 《信条》回归，并在流媒体上张开双臂拥抱https://www.billboard.com/pro/trending-up-creed-streaming-boosie-badazz-50-cent/Jason Lipshutz Thu, 16 Nov 2023 15:21:31 +0000 Chart BeatMusicNewsrockTrending Up https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235472929 In this week's Trending Up, the rock group scores eight-figure weekly streams, Boosie BadAzz benefits from a viral dance movement, and 50 Cent sparks a new relationship trend.

欢迎来到 Billboard Pro 的“流行趋势”专栏，在这里我们将仔细研究引起音乐行业关注的歌曲、艺术家、新奇事物和趋势。有些是凭空出现的，有些是花了几个月的时间才流行起来的，而所有这些都可能在 TikTok 视频的眨眼间变得无处不在。

本周：随着他们重聚的消息传出，《Creed》在流媒体领域的规模越来越大；舞蹈潮流推动了近十年历史的 Boosie BadAzz 曲目； 50 Cent 正在帮助 TikTok 用户解开爱情语言。

你能把流传输得更高吗？得益于团聚新闻、流浪者队等内容，Creed 的目录不断增加

经过十多年的相对沉默之后，过去几个月对于《信条》和他们的粉丝来说一直很忙碌。 7 月，这支最畅销的摇滚乐队宣布了自 2012 年以来的首场演出，“99 年之夏”巡演的领军人物将于 2024 年 4 月起航。几个月后，Creed 推出了一场全面的重聚巡演，他们在其中“从明年 7 月开始，我们会将《Higher》、《With Arms Wide Open》和《My Sacrifice》等热门歌曲带到北美 40 个城市。

重聚的消息恰逢乐队最近几周与体育赛事相关的一些病毒式传播时刻：上个月，德克萨斯游骑兵队的世界职业棒球大赛是通过在球队巴士上和比赛前吹奏“Higher”来推动的，这些音乐如滚雪球般涌入了他们的体育场跟着流浪者队的非正式国歌一起唱歌。

最近，用户@MaceAhWindu 发布的2022 年 TikTok中，一首史诗般的“Higher”合唱团与各种体育英雄搭配，引起了病毒式传播。这是与明尼苏达维京人队四分卫乔什·多布斯的达阵跑动同步的剪辑，多布斯随后重新发布了该片段：

无论是由于重聚巡演的消息、新的迷因还是两者的结合，《Creed》的流媒体总播放量在最近一周经历了相当大的增长。在宣布巡演的那一周（10 月 27 日至 11 月 2 日），Creed 的曲目在美国点播流媒体播放量为 903 万次——根据 Luminate 的数据，比前一周增长了近 18%——以及接下来的一周（11 月 3 日） -9)，每周播放总数攀升至 1012 万次。看看《Creed》的直播量在 2023 年飙升了多少，尤其是在 10 月份德克萨斯游骑兵队跑步和重聚巡演新闻不断涌现的情况下：

距离《Creed》首场重聚秀还有大约五个月的时间，所以我们将看看这些直播是否能在 2024 年初达到更高的水平，或许到达一个拥有金色街道的地方。- Jason Lipshutz

Boosie BadAzz 老歌取得新进展，进一步巩固经典之王地位

从《Wipe Me Down》到《Set It Off》， Boosie BadAzz 的热门歌曲为几代人的大学回扣和俱乐部之夜配乐。现在，由于一次偶然的舞蹈潮流，他近 10 岁的“Show da World”（与 Kiara、Webbie 和 Lil' Trill & Trill Family）在流媒体活动中迎来了重大突破。

据 Luminate 统计，11 月 3 日至 9 日期间，《Show da World》在美国的点播流媒体数量超过 20 万，与 10 月 27 日至 11 月 11 日期间相比，流媒体数量增长了 27.1%。 2（超过 158,000 个流）。过去三周，“Show da World”的涨幅达到了两位数。在这一趋势的发源地 TikTok 上，这首歌的官方声音在超过 20,200 个帖子中播放。用户@whytayyy 的休闲编舞引发了舞蹈潮流，其灵感源自WoopWoop 先生主导的舞蹈动作， 上个月Migos 的《Handsome & Wealthy》在流媒体上掀起了一场小型复兴。原始视频还包含一个古怪的简介，详细介绍了特定的友谊动态，但趋势已经演变为简单地执行舞蹈。

现在判断《Show Da World》能否进入Billboard Hot 100可能还为时过早，但凭借这种性质的流媒体收益，这首歌曲很可能会超越其在热门 R&B/ 排行榜上第 35 名的最初峰值。嘻哈歌曲。 - 凯尔·丹尼斯

50 Cent 和 Benny Benassi 凭借《Baby By Me》在串流媒体上大放异彩

TikTok 用户总能找到新的方式来表达让他们在浪漫和性方面感到快乐的事物，最近，他们使用Benny Benassi 2010 年对50 Cent的Ne-Yo协助的“Baby By Me”进行混音来做到这一点。

根据 Luminate 的数据，11 月 3 日至 9 日期间，《Baby By Me》在美国的点播播放量超过 637,000 次。与 10 月 27 日至 11 月 27 日期间的流媒体总量相比，增长了 16.3%。 2. 上周是《Baby By Me》连续第二周获得超过 50 万次播放量，考虑到这首歌在 10 月 13 日至 19 日期间的播放量刚刚超过 10 万次，这是一个特别令人印象深刻的壮举。

在 TikTok 上——创作者用这首歌为他们的伴侣（或潜在伴侣）用不同的方式表达爱的语言配乐——最受欢迎的“Baby By Me” 声音拥有超过 76,400 个帖子。本周，这首歌在TikTok 公告牌前 50 名中首次亮相，排名第 46 位，这是所有入围艺术家排名中的第一个条目。早在 2009 年，“Baby By Me”就成为 Fiddy 的第四张录音室专辑Before I Self Destruct的主打单曲。这首歌在热门 100 强歌曲中攀升至第 28 名，同时进入热门 R&B/Hip-Hop 歌曲和热门说唱歌曲前 10 名，并最终在新年期间（1 月 12 日）收到了 Benny Benassi 混音版。 1，2010）。

随着流媒体仍在增长，《Baby By Me》有望在 TikTok 公告牌前 50 名及其他排行榜上攀登更高的高度。 - KD

Since I was born and since I arrived to this world music and singing have always been an essential part of my […]

哥伦比亚传统艺术家丰塞卡讲述了他数十年的职业生涯，找到了平衡和快乐，并继续通过他的音乐为粉丝服务，由 Michelob ULTRA 呈现

丰塞卡：

我的名字是胡安·费尔南多·丰塞卡。自从我出生以来，自从我来到这个世界以来，音乐和歌唱一直是我生活中不可或缺的一部分。你可以用最自然、最天真的方式说，我正在看电视，而我旁边有一把吉他。我已经知道一些和弦了。我开始随意演奏，一段旋律开始​​出现，然后我为一首名为“电视”的歌曲写了歌词。

歌词是关于我当时在电视上看到的内容。我正在看新闻，嗯，那是哥伦比亚的困难时期，所以新闻不是最友善的，歌曲也谈到了这一点。我一直认为写《电视》的那一刻是我人生中的决定性时刻。当我说“我想制作一张CD”时，我突然有了一个动机。所以我做了一个预算并提交给我的父母，他们支持我。我把第一张专辑录制在磁带上。我复印了 500 份。我真的挨家挨户地卖了它们。这张 CD 让我与一家委内瑞拉唱片公司签约，并在那里开始了我的职业生涯。有一天，我在波哥大开车时，第一次在广播中听到了“Te Mando Flores”。当我第一次在收音机上听到这首歌时，我接通并说，“这是一首很棒的歌曲”。我感觉到了一些非常特别的东西，从那时起我的生活发生了变化。

这种平衡非常重要。工作、家庭、健康的平衡。身体健康。这很重要。我想人们越来越理解这一点了。每一场音乐会也像是一次两个小时的训练。所以，是的，我尝试平衡这一切，以便一切正常运转。

就我个人而言，我处于一个非常好的位置，可以说，因为与 Juan Luis Guerra 合作的这首歌“Si Tú Me Quieres”的结果，我找到了一条新的声音路径，我想继续一段时间。

; 泰特·麦克雷 (Tate McRae) 分享她的热门歌曲背后的秘密、最大的音乐灵感等等 |广告牌封面https://www.billboard.com/video/tate-mcrae-billboard-cover-interview/Stefanie Tanaka Thu, 16 Nov 2023 15:00:46 +0000 MediaVideosBillboardBillboard CoverTate McRae https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=pmc_top_video&p=1235473461 Rising pop star Tate McRae reveals all about her biggest career hits to date and reacts to seeing them appear on the Billboard charts, shares how artists like Noah Kahan, Rosalía, and Post Malone inspire her, talks about how excited she is for the Billboard Music Awards, how she went from aspiring dancer to rising […]

冉冉升起的流行歌星泰特·麦克雷 (Tate McRae) 讲述了她迄今为止职业生涯中最热门的歌曲，并看到它们出现在公告牌排行榜上时的反应，分享了诺亚·卡汉 (Noah Kahan)、罗莎莉亚 (Rosalía) 和波斯特·马龙 (Post Malone) 等艺术家如何激励她，谈论她对公告牌音乐有多么兴奋奖项，她如何从有抱负的舞者成长为流行歌星等等。

泰特·麦克雷
当 Instagram 上的Billboard发布前 10 张照片时，看到我的名字旁边有 Taylor Swift 和 Bad Bunny，感觉就更上一层楼了。是的，现在发生的事情感觉非常超现实。

泰特·麦克雷
嘿，我的名字是 Tate McRae，今天我们要攀登排行榜，看看我的音乐是如何上榜的，还有我的偶像，他们是如何上榜的。我记得那天我和妈妈一起散步。我记得我当时想，天啊，我在“Bubbling Under the Hot 100”排行榜上排名第一。我当时想，这是我一生中最重要的一天。当“You Broke Me First”到达第 17 名时，感觉非常疯狂，因为我觉得我刚刚在该排行榜上观看了我最喜欢的艺术家。我想一开始我并没有意识到“你先伤了我”的能力，直到我真正喜欢到达洛杉矶并意识到它已经到达了一个特定的地点并变得那么大。当我写《You Broke Me First》时，我才 16 岁。我当时想，我已经把这首歌推出了。我真的很想第一次看电影，我第一次喜欢合法的音乐视频是和我的朋友一起拍的。就像回到卡尔加里一样，在我手机上的 Video Star 上，整个音乐视频只有两遍。太疯狂了。现在有这么多的观点。回头看看它确实是在 iPhone 上制作的，真是太奇怪了。

; “煤炭”歌手迪伦·戈塞特与 Big Loud Texas/Mercury Records 签约：“这是一个梦想场景” https://www.billboard.com/pro/coal-singer-dylan-gossett-signs-record-label-talks-new-ep/Jessica Nicholson Thu, 16 Nov 2023 15:00:00 +0000 CountryMusicBig LoudMercury https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235473318 Gossett talks to Billboard 关于他的第一张唱片合约以及制作他的 EP 《No Better Time》的信息。;

迪伦·戈塞特今年将“煤炭”变成了钻石。

据 Luminate 称，这位 24 岁的德克萨斯人凭借这首自己创作的歌曲在流媒体上大受欢迎，该歌曲在 Spotify 的所有流派 Viral 50 排行榜上名列前五，并在美国官方流媒体点播总数中积累了 3950 万次。 《Coal》目前在公告牌热门乡村歌曲排行榜上排名第 35 位。

最初自行发行的《Coal》现在成为 Gossett 新 EP《 No Better Time》 （10 月 27 日发行）的基石，而这位歌手最近与 Range Media Partners 合作签约 Big Loud Texas/Mercury Records。 Big Loud Texas最近由米兰达·兰伯特 (Miranda Lambert)、乔恩·兰德尔 (Jon Randall) 和 Big Loud Records 合资成立。

有关的

米兰达·兰伯特 (Miranda Lambert) 和乔恩·兰德尔 (Jon Randall) 与 Big Loud Records 合作推出 Big Loud Texas

11/16/2023

“来自水星的泰勒（阿诺德）和杰克（莱文森）飞到德克萨斯州与我会面，我们立刻就达成了共识，”戈塞特谈到他的签约时说道。 “在与来自 Big Loud 的 Jon、Miranda 和 Seth [England] 会面后，能够联合力量并作为一个团队一起完成这一切，这是一个梦想的场景。”

戈塞特大约两年前创作了《煤炭》，当时并没有计划专业创作音乐。他最大的目标是在祖父的湖边小屋参加家庭聚会。

“每当感恩节或复活节等节日到来时，我的兄弟、父母、表兄弟姐妹都会围坐在篝火旁，传递吉他，”戈塞特说。 “主要是我、我的兄弟和我的表弟会演奏我们写的歌曲，但每个人都会唱歌。”

今年早些时候，戈塞特开始在 TikTok 上发布歌曲，包括翻唱 The Lumineers 的《Ophelia》和 Flatland Cavalry 的《A LifeWhere We Work Out》。据 Luminate 称，6 月，他发行了原创歌曲“To Be Free”，该歌曲在美国官方点播流媒体播放量已达到 650 万次。但 7 月份发行的《Coal》被证明是他的突破，使他的 Spotify 每月听众数量超过 400 万。

“《煤炭》只是我为艰难时期写的一首有意义的歌曲，”戈塞特说。 “我觉得我的职业生涯有点循规蹈矩，而且还有一些家庭事务要处理。写这首歌帮助我在精神上度过了难关，我认为这就是为什么它与人们如此相关的原因——每个人每天都会经历这些类型的事情。当我看到人们对我在网上发布的《煤炭》视频的反应时，我告诉我的妻子朱莉娅，“我现在必须录制这首歌。”我有一个朱莉娅为圣诞节送给我的麦克风和一个小音箱，我就坐在卧室里的笔记本电脑上录制了《煤炭》。”

这首歌主打《No Better Time》 ，这是一个朴素的项目，戈塞特在奥斯汀郊外这对夫妇家的卧室里，在他的笔记本电脑上完全创作、录制、制作和混音。该项目首次亮相就在 Billboard 的 Heatseekers 专辑排行榜上排名第七。

“我演奏了所有乐器，除了小提琴部分。我有一个好朋友进来演奏这些——我不会拉小提琴，”他笑着说。 “封面艺术是我朋友比利为我录制的一张照片。它完全包含一个自制项目。令人鼓舞的是，您只需在卧室里用一百美元的设备就可以拥有一张非常酷的声音唱片。”

本周公告牌排行榜上首次上榜的 10 位歌手：迪伦·戈塞特、MCVERTT、丹尼斯·奎德、弗拉米·格兰特……

11/16/2023

《No Better Time》中的每首歌都贯穿着戈塞特富有诗意的歌词。 “怎样才能感觉自己还活着？/你需要经历低谷才能热爱高潮吗？”他在“掷硬币”节目中问道。他在鼓舞人心的《No Better Time》中沉思道，“皮肤上的汗水胜过心中的悔恨”，并在《Lone Ole Cowboy》中描绘了枪手最后时刻的故事，歌词是：“我听到子弹飞过，就像我做出最后的抵抗/我是一个手里拿着枪在颤抖的人。”

Simultaneously, McRae's creative process shifted as she finally found a consistent co-writing crew in Ryan Tedder, Amy Allen and Jasper Harris. She says the way they made her forthcoming second album, Think Later (out Dec. 8 on RCA), was how she always imagined her idols made albums, with a sense of togetherness. “My last album wasn't like that at all … I was getting songs from 10 different people and being like, 'OK, here's an album.' And this time it was written by the same core group of people,” she says. “That's what made the process so fun for me, because it actually felt like a project that I was working on.”

Already, the new process is yielding results. Sultry lead single “Greedy” has become McRae's highest-charting hit to date, peaking at No. 11 on the Hot 100, driven by 104.2 million on-demand streams, according to Luminate, and its usage in 1.3 million TikTok videos. But arguably, its biggest accomplishment has been reintroducing McRae to the masses — as an artist who, this time, knows exactly who she is.

While McRae says fans shouldn't expect the entire album to sound like “Greedy,” she thinks the song represents a stylistic through line of “straight pop. It's also pretty savage.” She credits the shift to her alter ego, Tatiana, McRae's tour persona whom she describes as “ballsy, so loud and obnoxious.”

In the studio, “I was like, 'I don't really give a f–k. I just want to say what I want to say and I want to be 20 years old,' ” she says. “Sometimes you just want to go out and have a good time and just live life and be present and follow your intuition and not think too hard about it — and I just didn't feel like thinking too hard about a lot of these songs. I don't think people are going to expect me to say the stuff that I'm saying.”

In other words, as Fleckenstein puts it: “Some of these records, you're going to stop in your tracks and go, 'I didn't realize she could do that.' ”

When we talk in early November, McRae tells me her last few weeks have felt like “a bit of a dream.” “Greedy” blasted off; she announced her second album along with a world tour, during which she'll play her first hometown show and end at Madison Square Garden; and she started prepping for her Saturday Night Live musical guest debut. But, perhaps most impressively, she got her collaborator Tedder to work on a Sunday.

“She's the first artist to get me to [do that] in close to 10 years!” exclaims Tedder, who executive-produced Think Later . “I don't care how much I love you, who you are, how many Grammys or how high the stakes are, I don't work on weekends. The song came together in one weekend — and after she had technically finished her album. The two had started working at 10 am, going through sequences and punching vocals, with the goal of wrapping by 7 pm About an hour in, McRae revealed she felt that one box had yet to be checked, sonically speaking, on the album. “We had already sent the tracklist to the label, and at 6 pm, we walked out with a song completely written, recorded, vocaled and produced,” Tedder says. “It's the fastest, craziest Hail Mary of my entire life.” The next day, a Sunday, they listened with what he calls “tomorrow ears” and finished the track with enough time for it to make it on Think Later .

McRae and Tedder first met over a Zoom session in 2020, after being connected by mutual friend and songwriter-producer J Kash. As they both recently recalled to each other, they wrote a “trash” song that day and didn't work together again until late last year, on Tiësto's thumping dance-pop track “10:35” (on which McRae features). It was clear to Tedder then that McRae had “started to definitively put up guideposts.”

That became even more apparent during their first session together late last year for Think Later , when they wrote one of Tedder's favorite songs on the album. “That session started with her walking in, opening up a playlist that she made that had 21 to 22 songs on it, and [saying], 'These are the songs that shaped [me]. I want to figure out the through line and attempt to beat some of these,' ” he recalls. “She had words and phrases and endless amounts of topics and real-life stories to write from, and that just doesn't happen. I can count on one hand the artists I've worked with in 20 years that have pulled that on day one. And it was the most refreshing thing in the world. Otherwise, you're playing pin the tail on the donkey in the dark.” (As further proof, he adds that McRae's mix notes are so detailed “you'd think Quincy Jones wrote them.”)

That session led to many more with the same tight-knit team — just how McRae had always envisioned making an album — including the one for “Greedy.” Earlier this year, Tedder had posted on Instagram a few early-2000s songs he was revisiting, including some by Nelly Furtado, to which McRae replied that she had been listening to the same material. “There was a discussion like, 'Would it work now?' ” Tedder says. “I said, 'One hundred percent it will.' I'm just old enough where I know cycles, and this cycle is going to happen.”

McRae calls “Greedy” a “wild pass” on which they tried a totally new sound and beat — and just as Tedder predicted, it worked big time. She remembers debuting the single during her Philadelphia tour stop: “No one knew it was coming, and I remember feeling it that first night, like, 'Holy sh-t, what's going to happen with this song?' ”

And while fans may not have known when to expect the song, they knew something was coming thanks to McRae's TikTok, where she boasts 5.5 million followers (the most of her social media accounts) and had been teasing the song in a series of clips. (Within days of finishing her last song created with Tedder, she had already started teasing that on the app, too.)

“She is not scared or shy about playing music for fans and talking about what she's doing, and she is driving that conversation every step of the way,” Fleckenstein says. “It's not a record label ta-da! that you're seeing around her where there's some orchestrated marketing promotional shtick. This is about her making something, delivering it to her fans and saying, 'This is what I care about, and I hope you do, too.' And then we, as her partners and label, are making it as big as we can possibly make it.”

Tedder says he always tells McRae that, when it comes to social media savvy, “you're the female [Lil] Nas [X] and he's the male Tate,” adding that, “Understanding that the world lives on the internet and understanding what people want to hear, how they want to hear it and how they want it to be presented, that is its own art form now that I didn't have to contend with when I started. I played a gig last night and was with Kygo and The Chainsmokers, and [The Chainsmokers'] Alex [Pall] and Drew [Taggart] cornered me to talk about Tate, and Drew said, 'Man, I've been watching what's going on with that song. She gets the internet.' ”

Which is why McRae was well aware that the “Greedy” music video — in which she heats up an ice rink with her impressive dance moves, which she worked on with choreographer-to-the-stars Sean Bankhead — would land so well. “I'm really particular with my taste, and that hasn't always translated through what the internet has seen of me, even with what I'm wearing and how I'm performing and the choreography,” she says. “I'm so proud of [the “Greedy” video] because I got to actually be a dancer and make a video that I was like, 'This is sick. I want to show my friends.' I never ever used to feel that way.”

Now she's thinking of how to translate this previously untapped swagger to the stage. On her most recent tour, which wrapped in October, McRae wanted to push herself as a vocalist rather than relying on her dance background to carry the show. And yet, those roots are what so many in McRae's inner circle call her “magic.” As Tedder says, “She can outdance any pop star and it's something she rarely flexes — and she flexed in [the “Greedy”] video.”

“The truth is, she is winning because she is singular,” Fleckenstein adds. “And particularly in a pop landscape — which is often a fickle and very difficult place to be successful — you need to be that good.”

And no one understands that better than McRae herself. When she names the artists she most admires, they're a reflection of her own ambition — and many are former dancers who translated that foundation into global pop superstardom. “When I look at my favorite icons or videos or performances, it's always the biggest pop stars, so I think that's always a goal,” she says. “I think what defines a pop star is how iconic [they are]: Madonna, Britney [Spears], Christina [Aguilera]; they would put on these shows and blow everybody away and make timeless art. And that's what I want to do: make timeless art and timeless performances — and strive to keep on doing that.”

Panning to look at WMG's full-year results, for the 12 months ended Sept. 30, the company stressed that fiscal 2022 benefited from having an additional week in the reporting period. The remaining billion ($1.088 billion to be exact) derived from music publishing, which improved by 14% year-over-year.
